Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Biologic Mesh Remodeling in Abdominal Tissue Repair

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, biologic meshes were biopsied from the abdominal tissue repair sites of 40 patients

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients undergoing abdominal re-exploration with prior biologic mesh implantation. The study was conducted at a tertiary care center.

Intervention.evidence: biologic meshes were biopsied from the abdominal tissue repair sites of 40 patients during an abdominal re-exploration

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the associations between patient characteristics or surgical site classifications and the histologic remodeling scores of biologic meshes used in abdominal soft tissue repair.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the composite remodeling score (CR), measured at the time of re-exploration.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to patient allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: biologic meshes were biopsied from the abdominal tissue repair sites of 40 patients

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted using a per-protocol approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The model selection process for the cell infiltration (CI) score yielded two variables: age at mesh implantation and mesh classification (c-statistic=0.989).
